alert.note: Alert for Aitkin; Cass; Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 7:13AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota and north central Minnesota, including the following counties, in east central Minnesota, Aitkin. In north central Minnesota, Cass and Itasca. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 AM CDT, Runoff from heavy rain overnight continued. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen and runoff from this rain will continue today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hill City, Swatara, Waukenabo, Haypoint, Bain, White Elk Lake and Esquagamah Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
